intro: Bromheadia obyrneorum, commonly known as the red-tipped bromheadia, is a flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Bromeliaceae, which includes many epiphytic and terrestrial plants. The plant is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves that form a central cup, which collects water and nutrients. Its striking red-tipped leaves make it a popular ornamental plant in tropical gardens. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil for optimal growth.
